name: Metvurst
tagline: meteorological visualisation utilities using R for science and teaching
body:
Welcome to metvurst!
===
metvurst has two components:  
  
**_METeorological Visualisation Utilities using R_**  
**_Using R for Science and Teaching_**

For examples and showcases of the metvurst package see [the metvurst blog](http://metvurst.blogspot.de)
***


**_metvurst is implemented in R:_**  
In case you want to install metvurst, make sure you have devtools installed and loaded and then simply type:

```R
install_github('metvurst', 'tim-salabim')
library(metvurst)
```

***

**_Note:_**  
this package is only a skeleton a the moment. I will progressively add bits'n'pieces (especially documentation and examples) in the near future.

Have fun!

In case you have queations, suggestions or critique, don't hesitate to get in touch.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
